title: Refactor to Shorthands
description: Take the verbose Flutter code and refactor it to use modern Dart 3.10 dot shorthands where applicable. Remember: Colors.amber should NOT be shortened - it's a static constant, not an enum!
instructions: Convert the verbose enum syntax to modern dot shorthand syntax. Be careful: only enums can use shorthands, not static constants like Colors.

testCases.description: MainAxisAlignment and CrossAxisAlignment use dot shorthands
TextAlign, FontWeight, FontStyle use dot shorthands
BoxFit and Alignment use dot shorthands

hints.text: Look for places where the type is obvious from the parameter name, like mainAxisAlignment expects MainAxisAlignment.
Remember: Colors is a class with static constants, NOT an enum. Colors.amber cannot become .amber.
Replace EnumName.value with just .value when the parameter type makes the enum clear.

commonMistakes.consequence: Compilation error - Colors is not an enum
commonMistakes.correction: Keep Colors.blue as is - only enums support dot shorthands

commonMistakes.mistake: Using shorthands in older Dart versions
commonMistakes.correction: Check your Dart SDK version in pubspec.yaml
Shorthands only work when the type is clear from context
